soc.message
Class BoardLayout2

java.lang.Object
  soc.message.Message
      soc.message.BoardLayout2
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class BoardLayout2
extends Message

This message contains the board's layout information and its encoding version. The layout is represented as a series of named integer arrays and named integer parameters. These contain the hex layout, the number layout, where the robber is, and possibly the port layout. This message does not contain information about where the player's pieces are on the board.

Names of typical parts of the board layout:

    HL: The hexes, from Board#getHexLayout() NL: The dice numbers, from Board#getNumberLayout() RH: The robber hex, from Board#getRobberHex() PL: The ports, from Board#getPortsLayout()
Unlike BoardLayout, dice numbers here equal the actual rolled numbers. BoardLayout required a mapping/unmapping step.

Since:
1.1.08
Author:
Jeremy D Monin
See Also:
BoardLayout, Serialized Form

BoardLayout2

public BoardLayout2(java.lang.String ga,
                    int bef,
                    java.util.Hashtable parts)
Create a BoardLayout2 message

Parameters:
ga - the name of the game
bef - the board encoding format number, from Board#getBoardEncodingFormat()
parts - the parts of the layout: int[] arrays or Strings or Integers. contents are not validated here, but improper contents may cause a ClassCastException later.

toCmd

public java.lang.String toCmd()
Formatted string to send this BOARDLAYOUT2 over the network. BOARDLAYOUT2 sep game sep2 encoding {item}

Each item's format is either:

  • sep2 name sep2 value
  • sep2 name sep2 '['length sep2 value sep2 value ...

Specified by:
toCmd in class Message
Returns:
the command string
